@@ -62,4 +62,4 @@ - *

In general, different BufferedReaders should not be used to read from - * the same Reader. There is no way for a BufferedReader to know what another - * BufferedReader has read from the underlying Reader, nor does it have access - * to the other BufferedReader's internal buffer. + *

More than one instance of BufferedReader should not be used with the + * same underlying Reader instance. Doing so can cause the BufferedReader + * instances to return an incorrect result since each instance of + * BufferedReader maintains its own state.
